news_header: Spain faces severe flooding, with 95 confirmed dead and many missing. Meanwhile, Georgia's election results show a government victory, and various global incidents are reported.
news_text: Rescue operations are ongoing in Spain as the country experiences its worst flooding in decades, resulting in at least 95 confirmed deaths and numerous missing persons. In Georgia, the government secured nearly 54% of the vote in recent elections, despite opposition claims of irregularities. A series of global incidents include a deadly attack in Turkey, a trial involving Gisèle Pelicot, and a Russian whale watcher found alive after two months. Additionally, wildfires in Portugal have claimed lives, and flash flooding has damaged homes across Europe.
